title: Monument Field Inspector
description:
Our associates celebrate lives. We celebrate our associates.


Consider the possibilities of joining a Great Place to Work!


The Monument Field Inspector will be responsible for documenting inscriptions and design features of existing monuments through detailed impressions. This role will also be responsible for inspecting, cleaning and repairing monuments to ensure their preservation, integrity and personal significance.


**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Work with Processing and Sales locations on received orders and for checking existing jobs at various locations and understand status requirements.
* Process paperwork and organize daily workloads to ensure orders are completed in a timely and efficient manner.
* Maintain a professional relationship with 3rd party vendors and cemeteries.
* Update electronic records in Monument Tracking System, daily, to ensure accuracy.
* Utilize weekly reports to track order process and items for follow-up.
* Communicate with sales staff and design team to understand specific needs, provide updates on work progress, and address any concerns related to the monuments.
* Carefully create detailed impressions or rubbings of existing monuments to document inscriptions and design features, ensuring accurate records for maintenance or restoration purposes.
* Conduct thorough inspections of headstones to assess their condition, identifying any signs of wear, damage, or deterioration.
* Utilize appropriate cleaning techniques and materials to remove dirt, moss, and other debris from headstones, ensuring that the cleaning process does not damage the stone or inscriptions.
* Perform repairs on headstones as needed, which may include stabilizing or reattaching broken pieces, filling in cracks, and addressing other structural or aesthetic issues to restore the monument’s integrity and appearance.
* Manage regular maintenance of all necessary equipment and vehicles.
* Order supplies necessary to preform job duties.
* This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the essential functions or duties related to this job

**MINIMUM** **Requirements**


**Education**


* High School Diploma or equivalent required.

**Certification/License**


* Current New York state driver’s licenses with an acceptable record.
* Obtain and maintain any necessary licenses or permit as required to perform duties.

**Experience**


* Demonstrated proficiency in operating and maintaining small hand and power tools.
* Monuments or related industry experience preferred.
* Experience in working with data tracking software preferred.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**


* Ability to obtain and understand cemetery rules, regulations and layout.
* Attention to detail.
* Ability to travel locally within geographic territory as required.
* Accurate math skills.
* Ability to think critically and offer practical options.

title: Customer Engagement Manager
description:
**Country:**

United States of America**Location:**

CAN35: CCS-New York, NY 1350 Broadway Ste 2300, New York, NY, 10018 USA
Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.

 **About This Role**  

Carrier Commercial Service has an opening for a Customer Engagement Manager for our North America Commercial Service business. The role will bring a dimension of strategic advisement focused on maximizing Carrier’s contribution to the achievement of our customers’ goals. They will leverage available performance data from the connected, installed base of customers.


The insights arising from the analysis of this data will drive proposals and deployment of action plans best suited to maximize Carrier’s contribution to our customers. Through consistent, proactive attention to Customer Engagement Manager is positioned to facilitate opportunities for expanding customer’s reliance on Carrier as a trusted contributor to their success.


The role is designed for a naturally proactive, technically adept individual who believes in nurturing long-term, value-based customer partnerships that enhance customer outcomes. This role demands a comprehensive technical understanding of building systems and our products (hardware and software) with the ability to inspire customers with the power of data-based tools.

  

It is important to note: While the Customer Engagement Manager role facilitates sales, it does so indirectly, through the trust established with the customer. The role is not designed to carry a sales quota or incentives, but will be responsible for other metrics, related to retention, renewals, customer satisfaction, perceived impact etc.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage a client roster, ensuring a level of trust and loyalty that will prompt customers to expand their partnership with Carrier.
* Developing trust-based relationships and elevating them into mutually valuable long-term partnerships.
* Translating applied equipment data reports into actionable steps for our customers that are shared through our account managers.
* The role includes guiding customers through their journey, aligning resources and intentions, and helping achieve KPIs critical to customer success.
* Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities, maintain internal cross-functional alignment to customer values.
* Acts as a Customer Champion within Carrier, aligning internal resources with customer strategic priorities.
* Influence change within customers to drive adoption of best practices and successful change management methodologies, thereby deriving optimal utilization of the product.
* Work directly with customers, Sales and Operation teams, and senior executive teams
* Collaborate with other departments within Carrier’s Support, Implementation, Project Managers, Product.
* Influence your customers to adopt additional functionality and/or offerings, demonstrating the value it will bring to their organization.
* Predict and forecast risk, problem-solve and work independently.
* Prepare internal and external Business Reviews.

**Basic Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Engineering or 10+ years of HVAC industry experience with a High School Diploma/GED
* 1+ years of experience within the HVAC industry
* 1+ years of experience in business development or account management

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Knowledge of Commercial HVAC Building Systems
* Knowledge of the industry, market and key market participants
* Ability to work in a highly team-oriented and dynamic environment.
* Demonstrated strong written, verbal and presentation skills to effectively develop expectations and relationships with internal and external customers.
* Self-motivated and able to manage many simultaneous actions and requests.
* Extremely comfortable operating in a technical environment utilizing Microsoft based computer software.
* Goal-orientated with strong time management and organizational skills
* Exceptional interpersonal, strategic thinking, and data analysis skills
* Proven ability to communicate, present to, and influence key stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Account management and customer facing experience.
* Advanced problem-solving skills, verbal, and written communication skills

title: Client Services Manager
description:
**Are you looking for a new role where you can make a difference in the lives of others?** **Do you want to work for an agency that truly cares about its employees and the community?**

This is a wonderful opportunity to work in the home healthcare arena, and be part of a team devoted to providing outstanding service, brightening the lives of our elderly clients and offering peace of mind to their families.

We are seeking a Client Services Manager who is amazing at customer service, loves talking on the phone, has exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and is quick to learn new software. If you have a strong desire to help others, are a team player and would enjoy assisting our wonderful clients and field staff, this may be the opportunity you've been looking for.

The Customer Care Manager is responsible for scheduling of field staff, managing all touch-points (field staff, care recipient and family caregiver) and client care standards, and ensuring field staff are compatibility-matched while staying informed of client well-being.

**Experience with scheduling and working in the homecare industry is a huge plus.** 

***This is an on-site office position, Monday - Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm.*** 

**Benefits**

* Weekly pay with direct deposit
* Monthly stipend for health insurance premiums
* Generous PTO and paid holidays
* Friendly supportive coworkers
* Comfortable and casual work environment
* Family atmosphere
* Bonus Opportunities
* Serve the community
* Room for growth and advancement

**Responsibilities**

* Customer/client care – effectively manages the customer care procedures and serves as the point of contact for client/customer relations.·
* Scheduling and care coverage – supports and uses all technology tools and resources to ensure proper business processes; schedules staff to meet client care needs and minimize non-billed overtime.
* Answers all in-coming calls with a smile, addressing the caller's needs, and transferring to appropriate party when necessary.
* Assists with the intake of new clients and informs potential clients of our services and reasons to utilize BrightStar Care over other agencies.
* Provide information to be used for statistics, reports, and records for purposes of evaluation and reporting of organization activities.
* Works cooperatively with office staff to select and choose the best caregiver to suite our clients' needs.
* Assures compliance with all local, state, and federal laws

**Requirements**

* Bachelor degree or a minimum of 2 years experience as a Customer Care Manager and/or managing customer service within a healthcare office setting; knowledge of HIPAA and healthcare office regulations
* Strong computer skills; Microsoft Office literate with the ability to learn new software
* Flexibility, good time management and multi-tasking skills A MUST
* Excellent organization, planning, interpersonal and project management skills
* Experience with staffing in a healthcare setting a huge plus

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Athletic Trainer
description:
**Position Summary**  

  

On behalf of the MLB Youth Academy, the athletic trainer will be able to demonstrate an ability to perform the following functions regarding athletic injuries: prevention, assessment, treatment, (including first aide) and reconditioning as set forth by the NATA Board of certification.
  

  

**Essential Functions**

* Obtain an intimate knowledge of all facets of athletic training and human development, and coordinate coverage of baseball and softball activities at the MLB Youth Academy, including workouts, leagues, tournaments, field rentals, etc.
* Recruit and coordinate athletic training for the purpose of injury prevention and interpersonal development
* Coordinate athletic training vocational programming in conjunction with outside resources of the Academy
* Communicate upcoming training classes and recruit athletes for vocational training courses
* Assist coordinator of administration with the development, completion, and distribution of appropriate medical documentation
* Liaison with local medical services and doctors to ensure the wellbeing of Academy members
* Work with local universities to place students into viable athletic training programs and be a resource to train student trainers

* Certified by the National Athletic Trainers' Association
* Curriculum development background
* Administration oriented

title: Product Manager, Mlb App
description:
Major League Baseball is committed to creating the best fan experience products in professional sports. We strive to harness the awesome storytelling power of baseball to help people enjoy the National Pastime in ways that matter to all types of fans. We are seeking a Product Manager to join our product team and help us achieve that mission.
  

  

In this role, you will join a team of dedicated product managers to work with our partners in design, engineering, content and business to serve our customer: the MLB fan. Reporting to the Sr. Director, Product, you will help to develop and execute the product strategy for MLB's flagship product, the MLB App on both iOS and Android. The MLB App is used by millions of fans each day to follow their favorite teams and players, get real time updates and engage with the sport of baseball through exclusive MLB content.
  

  

Our ideal Product Manager knows and has experience with the best practices of modern product development, loves to iterate on user experience and has worked on a product that publishes a wide variety of content types.
  

  

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**  

  

**Education and Experience**

* 3+ years of experience as a product manager supporting one or more consumer-facing products – experience with native apps (iOS and/or Android) is a big plus
* A strong portfolio of shipped products that show a data-inspired strategy and analytics influenced decision making
* Experience in using quantitative and qualitative data to identify opportunities and to measure success
* Are comfortable working with ambiguity and helping to define new ways of working
* Possess an appreciation for baseball and a firm comprehension of its history, rules, and culture
* Passion for visual design and great user experience and an understanding of information architecture
* An understanding of software engineering ecosystems and related technologies such as REST API's, Push Notification Services, oAuth, JSON and front end tech
* A critical thinker with strong written, verbal and storytelling skills

This is a unique opportunity to make a large impact and deepen the relationship between MLB and its 70M+ fans in a fast paced, fun environment in an industry that is always evolving.
  

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Work directly with fans and stakeholders to understand their needs and how we can deliver great experiences for them
* Create detailed technical requirements ready for development
* Define key performance indicators for product features and actively analyze data and customer feedback
* Design and deploy experiments to discover the best solutions for fans
* Work with key stakeholders to prioritize requirements from competing business interests and build consensus
* Balance between product ideation and execution, with a “fail fast” mentality and flexibility as we pursue innovative experiences for our fans
* Effectively support the product design, engineering and test engineering teams throughout sprint cycles by proactively removing roadblocks and anticipating challenges
* Build and manage relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders, including technology leaders, marketing teams, ad operations, sponsorship sales, external vendors and executives
* Keep a pulse on the sports, media, and entertainment best practices and trends, to create best-in-class products

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
  

  

Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!
  

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $105,000 - $135,000.

title: Manager, Intelligence And Incident Response
description:
The Intelligence and Incident Response Manager will lead incident response handling, threat intelligence, social media monitoring, digital investigations, and identifying/supporting relevant technologies.
  

  

**Essential Functions**

* Manage incidents with the Security Operations Center (SOC), the 30 Clubs, and their affiliates.
* Develop and implement tactical response procedures, guidelines, and playbooks to streamline security incidents.
* Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to manage responses to cybersecurity incidents.
* Manage the digital risk protection, threat intelligence, and social media monitoring programs for MLB, the 30 Clubs, and their affiliates and utilize OSINT, deep/dark web sources, industry tools, MITRE ATT&CK Framework, and internal research to monitor cyber and physical security risks and provide actionable intelligence and recommendations to the SOC.
* Stay up to date with relevant vulnerabilities, threat actors, indicators of compromise (IOCs) tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), and trends, identifying actionable areas of interest and threats that can target MLB and its users, while maintaining thorough documentation of cyber threats, threat vectors, threat actors, and threat trends for SOC consumption during threat modeling activities and security incidents.
* Perform highly confidential and in-depth digital investigations promptly, disseminating and, maintaining reports on highly confidential information, as directed.
* Plan, develop, and deliver security awareness training, education programs, and internal phishing campaigns to assess the internal security posture.
* Assist in managing the MLB domain portfolio and optimization efforts. Efforts include reviewing the portfolio for risk management, including but not limited to, cybersecurity risks and exposures and reducing costs to MLB.
* Effectively communicate actionable results to various stakeholders both internally and externally.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor's Degree in one of the following concentrations: Cybersecurity, Information Security, Computer Science, Criminal Justice, Criminology, or Law
* Minimum 4 years experience in incident response, threat intelligence, and/or digital investigations, with 1 year in a leadership role.
* Experience conducting in-depth investigations, digital forensics, and/or incident response handling.
* Demonstrated investigative experience using OSINT, social media sites, industry tools, and other sources.
* Experience with Endpoint Detection, Network Security, Security Event and Incident Management, Threat Intelligence
* Strong understanding of malicious adversaries, threat groups, and campaigns
* indicators of compromise (IOC) and highly granular tools, techniques, and procedures
* Ability to maintain confidentiality while dealing with sensitive information.
* Excellent organizational, time management, documentation, and communication skills with an ability to clearly articulate complex attack tactics and techniques are essential.
* Fluency in Spanish, Russian, Farsi, and/or Mandarin is a plus.

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. title: General Manager, Mls Next
description:
Overview
  

  

Developing world-class players is a core pillar for the long-term success and growth of Major League Soccer. MLS NEXT is the best youth player development experience in North America providing youth players with the highest levels of competition and training to prepare them for their futures, both in soccer and in life. The governance structure of MLS NEXT promotes collaboration, fosters innovation, and harnesses the expertise of all Member Clubs which now includes over 140 Clubs and 600 Teams. MLS NEXT accelerates the development of the best players in the US and Canada through comprehensive programming for players, coaches, referees, and parents. Clubs participating in MLS NEXT play through an 11-month season that concludes with playoffs and a final, crowning a national champion each season.
  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

Major League Soccer is looking for a dedicated, passionate, and experienced individual to grow and lead MLS NEXT. The General Manager, MLS NEXT will be responsible for managing and implementing MLS NEXT programs to continuously improve and elevate the quality of competition, talent identification, education, compliance, and club membership. The role requires vision, the ability to lead team members and external core collaborators, operating discipline, excellent communications skills, flexibility, as well as a strategic and innovative approach.
  

  

Responsibilities
  

  

**Primary Responsibilities**

* Manage and oversee governance and communication across all MLS NEXT member clubs, including all member calls and selected member committees.
* Manage and oversee execution of plans against the five pillars of the MLS NEXT platform: Competition, Talent ID, Education, Individual Development, and Environment.
* Lead relationships with cross functional teams who support MLS NEXT including Compliance, Legal, Events, Social, Content, Comms, Brand, Consumer Products, and Events.
* MLS NEXT Lead on legal related topics including compliance for governing policies, investigations and discipline, policy enforcement, and insurance coverage (in consultation with Technical Director, MLS NEXT on decisions requiring technical input).
* Lead relationship with Partnership Marketing/Business Development and liaise with partners on delivery and growth of commercial programs, with a key focus on generating revenue while maintaining MLS NEXT development principles and over indexing for the adidas enterprise partnership.
* Lead MLS NEXT commercial aspects including Marketing, Broadcast, Events, Social, etc.
* In collaboration with the Technical Director, MLS NEXT:
	+ Lead implementation of future evolution of MLS NEXT events.
	+ Drive the long-term strategy and planning process for MLS NEXT
	+ Manage and oversee MLS NEXT budget, collaborating with Technical Director, MLS NEXT on prioritization.
	+ Oversee MLS NEXT Club Evaluation process, including expansion and remediation.
	+ Implement and deliver sporting development initiatives, including technical guidance and standards as set forth by both MLS and MLS NEXT Technical Directors (example includes ‘Quality of Play' initiative).
	+ Manage and implement technology and data tools for MLS NEXT with support and input from Technical Directors of both MLS and MLS NEXT.

Manager Responsibilities


* Oversee team within MLS NEXT including hiring and development of MLS NEXT administrative and operations staff.
* Manage hiring and onboarding process by interviewing, selecting, orienting, and training employees
* Accomplish team results by communicating job expectations and leading the Performance Management process:
	+ Plan, monitor, and review performance
	+ Coach and counsel employees
	+ Develop and implement department procedures and productivity standards and reinforce Company policies
* Develop personal growth opportunities for employees by providing a challenging, learning environment that incorporates external opportunities to meet with other organizations.
* Attract, develop, and empower a successful organization with a strong, values-based culture.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree required; Sporting Licenses and Credentials preferred.
* 12+ years of experience in a leadership role, with responsibilities in strategy, competition management, and technical development.
* Relevant working experience in the sports industry.

**Required Skills**

* Demonstrated leadership and management capability.
* Commitment to high quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance.
* Excellent people skills, with an ability to interact effectively and in a professional and diplomatic manner with internal and external team members at all levels.
* Experience building sports and entertainment properties and events.
* Highly organized with excellent project coordination and project management skills.
* Resourceful, quick learner and able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing.
* Demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills.
* Meticulous with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
* Ability to travel and to work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Desired Skills**

* Knowledge of the Spanish Language (business proficiency).
* Understanding of the North American youth soccer and sports landscape.
* Knowledge of the sport of soccer.

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary: $190,000 – $215,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance!
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game!

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We are committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodations to employees with disabilities. MLS/SUM complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act and all other applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding disability discrimination and accommodation.

title: Coordinator, Business Development
description:
**Position Overview**  

  

The MLB Gaming & VR group drives the development, publishing, and licensing of Video Game and VR products for Major League Baseball. Located in the MLB Headquarters in New York City, the Coordinator, Business Development will collaborate with internal groups, licensing, and retail partners to assist in managing the current business and assist in generating new revenue opportunities for the MLB Games and VR group. Reporting to the Product Manager, Games & VR, the Coordinator, Business Development is a hands-on role that will support the strategy, planning, and execution of new business opportunities for Major League Baseball.
  

  

**Essential Functions**

* Work with internal and external marketing teams to support specific business functions on key licensed products.
* Support the day-to-day contract process to assist Business Development efforts.
* Manage day-to-day communications with current and prospective license partners.
* Support retail and digital channel efforts relating to MLB The Show annual video game releases
* Assist in qualifying new business revenue generating opportunities for the Games and VR group

**Qualifications and Skills**

* 2-4 or more years of relevant experience in B2B setting with focus on interactive entertainment is preferred
* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Communications, or equivalent field [Advanced degree or certification(s) is a plus.]
* Proven track record of managing project timelines
* Experience with highly sensitive or confidential information
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Familiarity and affinity with the video game industry
* An understanding and appreciation of the history and culture of the sport of baseball

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $62,500 - $67,500
  

  

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Replay Operator - (seasonal)
description:
Major League Baseball is looking for operators to produce 3D visualizations for MLB telecasts. Operators will utilize proprietary software to generate video packages that will be used both pre-game and in-game.
  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Set up graphic rendering software for assigned games
* Communicate with broadcasters & on-site personnel prior to games to ensure everything is functioning properly
* Generate assigned content and coordinate video feed to the proper broadcast truck
* Monitor and QC multiple live baseball games for in-game highlights
* Receive requests from producers/directors in-game
* Check for accuracy of data & stats on all graphics
* Log technical issues accurately and with detail

  

**Skills:**  

* Strong knowledge of baseball
* Some experience in a live production/broadcast environment
* Basic understanding of audio/video signal flow
* Must have excellent interpersonal skills, multi-tasking skills and a strong attention to detail
* Must have computer skills
* Must be willing to work nights/weekends/holidays

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is an hourly rate of $25.00. The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.
  

  

If you are interested in joining our team and require a reasonable accommodation to assist with any part of the application and/or interview process, please contact us by email at: accommodations@mlb.com

title: Marketing Manager, Games & Vr
description:
**Job Summary**  

  

Major League Baseball's Games & VR Group was founded in 2014 to bring incredible video game and augmented reality experiences to baseball fans across platforms and genres. Working from MLB's New York headquarters, the Marketing Manager will drive execution of marketing initiatives for MLB's owned and licensed products across console, mobile and XR platforms. The Marketing Manager will manage campaign on a range of MLB products, partnering with external marketing partners and internal counterparts across digital, social, PR, events and more. This role will lead a range of Go-to-Market initiatives for new games and existing products. The ideal candidate will have an established record robust, integrated campaigns and a true passion for the gaming and sports industries. You will be adept at working across a large and complex organization with multiple stakeholders, delivering on time and on budget.
  

  

**Responsibilities**

* Develop innovative marketing campaigns and executions for MLB Games & VR products, including brand ID, website, packaging, PR/gameplay assets and advertising materials.
* Manage relationships with first parties including asset creation and review, platform marketing, and promotions.
* Work effectively with internal teams including Social, Communications, Multimedia Operations and Editorial to ensure seamless execution of campaigns and initiatives.
* Develop product positioning and messaging for key marketing channels, ensuring consistent and engaging voice.
* Manage product budgets, revenue reporting and business intelligence in conjunction with internal teams.
* Work with License partners to support publishing/marketing efforts across platforms and channels.
* Work closely with the events team to plan and support live event executions.

**Qualifications**

* 5+ years of direct experience in video game marketing/publishing.
* Experience with brand management best practices and a suite of tools to successfully bring games to market.
* Strong creative perspective and the ability to develop engaging creative executions in a variety of media formats including digital, live production, social and digital formats.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. Editorial or copy-writing experience a major plus.
* Ability to synthesize analytics, data reporting, and customer insights into successful marketing strategies.
* Understanding of game and web development, video production, asset creation.
* Excellent business acumen, problem solving capabilities, and a practical approach to getting things done.
* Understanding of consumer facing events and ability to support live event production.
* A passion for baseball and video games.

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $85,000 - $110,000.
  

  

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. title: Paralegal
description:
Overview
  

  

The MLS Legal department is seeking a Paralegal to assist the Legal Affairs team with administrative tasks and certain tasks related to investigations, policies and presentations.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Support League policy management, including drafting, distribution, and compliance.
* Assist with the preparation of PowerPoint presentations and other materials, including decks, guides, tracking charts, checklists, and reports.
* Assist (under supervision of MLS attorneys) with investigatory needs, including factual analyses, informational intake, and summaries.
* Manage documents and electronic files, and the process for responding to litigation discovery requests.
* Provide support for independent contractor processes, including working on templates and interfacing with internal stakeholders on departmental needs and engagement requests.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree
* 2+ years at a law firm or in-house

**Required Skills**

* Detail-oriented, self-motivated individual with outstanding organizational and analytical skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Ability to proofread material for grammatical or spelling errors
* Sound business judgement, and flexibility/adaptability to prioritize, organize, manage and complete time sensitive matters without sacrificing accuracy
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively
* High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance
* Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced, team environment
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

**Desired Skills**

* Knowledge of the Spanish and/or French Language (business proficiency)

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary: $75,000 – 85,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance!
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game!

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We are committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodations to employees with disabilities. MLS/SUM complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act and all other applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding disability discrimination and accommodation.

title: Vice President, Business Affairs (legal)
description:
Overview
  

  

This position will partner with and provide legal counsel to the sponsorship, consumer products, marketing and club performance teams within Major League Soccer and its member clubs.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Provide legal advice for the League's partnership marketing, brand alliance, consumer products and marketing teams
* Structure, draft and negotiate sponsorship, licensing, agency and other commercial agreements
* Partner with the League's club performance team to advise MLS member clubs on commercial opportunities and sponsorships
* Draft, manage and interpret policies related to MLS member club commercial opportunities and ensure consistent application of those policies
* Manage team of legal professionals to facilitate efficient project allocation
* Provide coaching to accelerate growth of team members
* Work cross-functionally to manage risks, while providing practical and creative legal guidance
* Lead and perform special projects and other assignments as requested

Qualifications


* 12+ years of experience at a top tier law firm and/or corporate legal department; in-house experience with sports, entertainment or consumer products brand preferred
* Bachelor's degree and Juris Doctor
* Admission to NY State Bar

**Required Skills**

* Ability to make timely, nuanced recommendations for business decisions based on reasoned legal analysis and the strategic objectives of the organization
* Commercial approach to advising business teams
* Outstanding written and oral business communication skills
* Strong drafting and negotiating skills, including experience with commercial transactions
* Ability to manage a team and provide attention to career development of team members
* Superior organization, project management skills and attention to detail, necessary to support and advise business units and ensure projects are completed in a timely and effective manner
* High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment

**Desired Skills**

* Spanish and/or French language skills (business proficiency)
* Knowledge and interest in the sport of soccer

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary $200,000 to $250,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:
  

  

Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
  

  

Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
  

  

Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of the team and inspire you to elevate the Game!
  

  

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Associate Counsel, Intellectual Property (temporary Position)
description:
Overview
  

  

This position will support across several departments to manage Major League Soccer and Soccer United Marketing's domestic and international intellectual property portfolio. The intellectual property portfolio includes trademarks and copyrights for MLS clubs and other MLS/SUM properties, including MLS NEXT Pro, MLS NEXT, MLS GO, and Leagues Cup.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Partner with business teams and MLS Clubs to review IP matters with respect to new initiatives
* Perform searches and clearances for new proposed MLS, MLS club marks, MLS NEXT Pro, MLS NEXT Pro clubs, and SUM property marks
* Submit filings for new marks and manage USPTO office action responses
* Make timely filings to ensure ongoing protection of existing marks, including collecting and submitting specimens of use
* Manage outside counsel, particularly with respect to international IP portfolio management and MLS patent filings
* Advise on IP protection strategy and prepare cease and desist letters, as necessary
* Work with federal and local law enforcement agencies on anti-counterfeiting initiatives, including customs recordations and filings
* Work cross-functionally to manage risks, while providing practical and creative legal guidance

Qualifications


* 3+ years of experience at a top tier or IP law firm and/or corporate legal department; in-house experience preferred
* Bachelor's degree and Juris Doctor
* Admission to NY State Bar

**Required Skills**

* Knowledge of intellectual property law and USPTO rules and regulations
* Superior organization, project management skills and attention to detail, necessary to support and advise business units and ensure projects are completed in a timely and effective manner
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment
* Commercial approach to advising business teams
* Outstanding written and oral business communication skills
* Strong drafting and negotiating skills
* High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance

**Desired Skills**

* Knowledge and interest in the sport of soccer

**Total Rewards**  

  

Hourly Rate: $60 - $70/hour.
  

  

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Producer, Games & Vr
description:
An MLB Games & VR Producer is responsible for managing videogame and/or synthetic 3D baseball experiences from inception to completion. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of producing internal and external development of quality console and mobile games. You own products throughout their lifecycle.
  

  

Essential Functions


* Work with internal and external development teams to define project scope, goals, and deliverables in support of business goals
* Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders
* Manage and track tasks, ensuring schedules are maintained
* Coordinate and validate MLB logos and assets - help cultivate the MLB brand for gaming community
* Partner with key stakeholders to ensure projects are released on time with high quality
* Report progress, risks, and issues to key stakeholders
* Track project milestones and deliverables
* Perform related duties as required

Qualifications and Skills


* Superior communication skills
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience in professional mobile and/or game development
* Practical knowledge of current project management methodologies
* Effectively communicate vision and quality objectives
* Understanding of the rules and culture of baseball
* High degree of flexibility in approach - you must be able to balance structure and process with the needs of a creative and dynamic environment
* Experience on teams that have delivered multiple titles to market; You are deadline and detail oriented
* You're passionate about games. You are knowledgeable about games and game culture. You play games.
* Highly motivated and able to learn quickly
* Strong organizational, analytical, prioritization, and interpersonal skills
* Technically savvy with a strong general understanding of computer systems and software
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Programs such as PowerPoint, Excel, and Word

* The opportunity to work on baseball games in NYC with a world class team
* The opportunity to work on award-winning and complex games, apps, and systems
* The opportunity to have an influence on the innovation of products used globally by millions
* The opportunity to work in a highly collaborative team environment
* Amazing benefits including - 100% employer-paid Medical, Dental and Vision
