title: Gameday Monitor, Mlb (seasonal)
description:
**Overview**  

  

MLB is currently seeking part-time seasonal Gameday Monitors for the upcoming 2024 Major League Baseball season to provide quality assurance for live video and audio streams on MLB.TV. Ideal candidates will be available to work a minimum of 25 hours per week and must possess MLB's core competencies in areas such as collaboration, communication, critical thinking and relationship management.
  

  

Please note, Gameday Monitors will work remotely and must have a keen attention to detail, strong writing skills and will need to be actively engaged with their teammates during each shift.
  

  

**Responsibilities**  

  

**•** Monitor assigned home and away broadcast feeds in accordance to the daily gameday schedule. These feeds include but are not limited to pre and post game shows, audio streams and regional broadcasts for each designated game.
  

  

* Adhere to quality control guidelines and procedures without frequent supervision.

  

* Communicate gameday related issues immediately to the appropriate teams.

  

* Provide detailed reports that recap any issues that occurred during the game.

  

**Requirements**  

  

**•** A flexible schedule tied to the Major League Baseball season with availability on nights, weekends, and holidays is a must.
  

  

* A minimum of 25 hours per week is required for this position, no exceptions.

  

* Reliable WiFi, stable hardwire and home broadband network connection is essential.

  

* Ownership of at least 3 streaming devices such as a smart television, tablet, computer (PC and/or Mac), Apple or Android phone, Xbox, Playstation 5, Chromecast, etc. is preferred.

  

* Excellent communication skills to relay any issues or troubleshooting concerns to the appropriate channels is required.

  

* Ideal candidates are comfortable working in highly visible positions.

  

**Desired**  

  

* Familiar with MLB.com, MiLB.TV, MLB.TV, MLB At Bat and other streaming services.

  

* Experienced with providing quality assurance in digital media roles.

  

* Avid baseball viewers with a strong knowledge of the game are encouraged to apply.

  

* Prior sports industry experience is a plus.

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is an hourly rate of $16.00 to $16.00. The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.

title: Director, Brand Alliances (bilingual Spanish/english)
description:
Overview
  

  

As a member of MLS/SUM (Soccer United Marketing) team, the Director, Brand Alliances will be responsible for strategizing, building, and executing an end-to-end partnership sales and retention strategy from short-term to long-term. Based in New York, this position will work hand in hand with the Vice President, Brand Alliances to build sponsorship strategy and cultivate c-level relationships to bring value and profitability to grow the sport's relevance, engage fans and maximize enterprise revenue. This role will specifically help lead new enterprise sales efforts for the Mexican Football Federation (FMF) as well as Concacaf, home to the Men and Women's Gold Cup, Champions League, Nations League Finals, and other premier regional Club and National Team competitions.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Prospect, develop, and sell new integrated business partnerships to accomplish sales goals.
* Develop deep, meaningful relationships with national decision makers at brands that lead to long-term partnerships supporting the aforementioned properties and other strategic priorities for the League and greater SUM enterprise.
* Deliver strategic sales presentations and tailored business solutions to senior-level executives at prospective clients and agencies, while incorporating media, integrated platforms, and other benefits into such opportunities.
* Engage and collaborate with the enterprise (other departments, property constituents, MLS clubs, senior management, etc.) to close deals that deliver value beyond monetary benefit.
* Negotiate sponsorship deals from conversation inception to final contract.
* Create and effectively maintain reporting documents in an organized manner.
* Develop and track new revenue pipeline to present to senior leadership on a weekly/monthly basis.
* Develop innovative platforms and programs that enhance the fan journey and drive incremental revenue for MLS/SUM; take leadership in the creation of sales materials.
* Manage the relationship with Commercial Sales leads at Mexican Football Federation and Concacaf.
* Attend networking and promotional events to develop and maintain contact with potential clients and professional partners.
* Provide day-to-day oversight and take a team sales approach with Manager(s) and Coordinator(s) to help those individuals meet and exceed annual performance goals.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree Required. Advanced degree preferred.
* 8+ years of professional sponsorship experience in a high-performance sales environment; Sports, Entertainment, and/or Arena Industry experience preferred.
* Bi-lingual (English/Spanish)

**Essential Skills and Qualifications**

* 75+ existing “decision maker” brand contacts at the national level and agency relationships.
* Knowledge of sports and entertainment sponsorship, including promotions, events, media, and contracts.
* Ability to take a client through the entire sales funnel, from lead generation to closing.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team environment and form strong relationships with colleagues, clients, agencies, and sports organizations.
* Ability to navigate and collaborate with counterparts in other functional areas including but not limited to other departments that require meaningful interaction including Marketing, International / Events, Media, Digital, Club Services, Competition, Consumer Products, Legal, and Finance.
* Superior business and negotiating skills.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Experience with the development and execution of dynamic and effective platforms.
* Familiarity with the standard demographic research & analytics tools (i.e., Scarborough, YouGov, MRI-Simmons, etc.) and ability to derive insights from the data.
* High-level commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity, and compliance.
* Self-starter, but team player with the ability to work against both aggressive individual and department sales goals.
* High-energy, self-motivated with a solutions-oriented mindset.
* Proven experience managing and motivating a team.
* High proficiency in Microsoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
* Ability to travel and to work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

**Desired Skills (but not required):**

* Strong familiarity with sports, especially soccer

**TOTAL REWARDS:**  

  

Major League Soccer offers a competitive starting base salary of $115,000 - $150,000, based on individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs. We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent. Our benefits package includes comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, a $500 wellness reimbursement, generous PTO, and a hybrid office/remote work schedule to promote work-life balance. We also prioritize career and professional development, offering on-the-job training, feedback, and ongoing educational opportunities.
  

  

At Major League Soccer, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion and believe that a diverse workforce enhances our ability to compete in the marketplace. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We are dedicated to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation throughout the job application or interview process, essential job functions, and other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please contact us to request it.
  

  

Join our team and be part of the Major League Soccer family, where we elevate the game and inspire greatness!

title: Vice President, Corporate Communications
description:
Overview
  

  

Major League Soccer seeks a dynamic professional with a proven track record of success in communications. Work experience in the areas of brand/consumer communications and sponsorship marketing, as well as significant experience in sports and/or entertainment is strongly preferred. The individual selected for this opportunity will have a deep understanding of all types of editorial media, including a strong grasp of the digital and social media landscape. Experience and significant relationships with editorial decision makers in the areas of business and lifestyle media are critical to this role. This person who fills this role will possess an entrepreneurial spirit, acumen in executive communications and the ability to make decisions and executive plans in settings comparable to the fast-paced world of professional sports. The position is based in New York, NY.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Lead communications strategy for organization's key business units, including but not limited to, partnership marketing (sponsorship), brand alliance (new business development), emerging ventures, consumer products, social/digital media, and community engagement.
* Serve as the team member to lead communications for 50+ corporate partners as it pertains to their activation around MLS/SUM.
* Collaborate with internal departments, MLS clubs and external partners to drive storytelling to achieve desired program outcomes.
* Develop corporate communications (off-sports page) strategy and serve as agency for clubs.
* Manage communications for select executives through interviews, high-impact media opportunities, and events; prepare executives to ensure consistent messaging.
* Serve as the organization's partner for executive visibility strategy inclusive of endemic and non-endemic awards, conferences and lists.
* Support communications strategy for MLS/SUM in the areas of business, lifestyle/entertainment, and philanthropy.
* Support communications for various marketing and sponsorship initiatives around MLS' marquee events (ex: MLS All-Star Game presented by Target, MLS Cup presented by Audi, among others).
* Work closely with a variety of internal and external partners to manage communications the League's consumption narrative.
* In coordination with the Senior Vice President of International Communications, contribute towards business communications strategy of various SUM properties, including CONCACAF Gold Cup, Mexican National Team U.S. Tour, Campeones Cup, and Leagues Cup among others.
* Successfully manage complex, fast paced and unexpected communications opportunities, including select crisis situations.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree
* 12+ years of experience in Communications

**Required Skills**

* Ability to develop and complete highly effective communications, public relations, and partner/stakeholder relations strategies in a complex environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally
* Positive, engaging personality (in order to gain the respect of a variety of influential partners).
* Ability to clearly understand and empathize with multiple points of view, build strong relationships of trust and respect with a wide variety of collaborators, effectively use influencing skills to gain buy-in and collaboration.
* Unquestioned integrity.
* High energy.
* Excellent listening skills.
* Superior organization, project management skills and attention to detail
* High level of dedication to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
* Demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills
* Diligent with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision

**Desired Skills**

* Knowledge of a second language (business proficiency) preferred
* Knowledge of the sport of soccer
* Ability to travel and to work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary: $200,000 – 220,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Director, Brand Alliances
description:
Overview
  

  

As a member of the MLS/SUM (Soccer United Marketing) team, the Director, Brand Alliances will have a crucial role in developing and implementing a comprehensive strategy for partnership sales and retention. This position is based in the dynamic city of New York, NY and provides an exceptional opportunity to collaborate closely with the Vice President, Brand Alliances in creating a sponsorship strategy that enhances value, profitability, and growth for Major League Soccer. The primary focus of this role will be on leading new enterprise sales efforts, highlighting your exceptional ability to form strategic alliances.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Prospect, develop, and sell new integrated business partnerships to achieve ambitious sales goals.
* Cultivate deep, meaningful relationships with national decision makers at leading brands, fostering long-term partnerships that support our properties and strategic priorities.
* Deliver flawless sales presentations and tailored business solutions to senior-level executives at prospective clients and agencies, showcasing the wide range of media, integrated platforms, and other benefits available.
* Collaborate closely with various departments, MLS clubs, and senior management to close deals that deliver value beyond financial gains.
* Successfully navigate sponsorship deals from initial discussions to finalizing contracts.
* Maintain organized reporting documents to effectively track progress and results.
* Develop and manage a new revenue pipeline, providing regular updates to senior leadership.
* Take the lead in creating innovative platforms and programs that enhance the fan journey and drive incremental revenue for MLS/SUM.
* Actively participate in networking and promotional events to expand your professional network and foster connections with potential clients and partners.
* Provide day-to-day oversight and support to Manager(s) and Coordinator(s) to help them exceed annual performance goals, fostering a collaborative team sales approach.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent relevant experience required
* Minimum of 8 years of professional sponsorship experience in a high-performance sales environment. Experience in the Sports, Entertainment, and/or Arena Industry is preferred.

**Essential Skills and Qualifications**

* Possess a network of 75+ existing "decision maker" brand contacts at the national level, along with strong agency relationships.
* In-depth knowledge of sports and entertainment sponsorship, including promotions, events, media, and contracts.
* Proven ability to guide clients through the entire sales funnel, from lead generation to closing.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, team environment, excelling in forming strong relationships with colleagues, clients, agencies, and sports organizations.
* Collaborate effectively with counterparts in various functional areas, including Marketing, International/Events, Media, Digital, Club Services, Competition, Consumer Products, Legal, and Finance.
* Demonstrated strong understanding of business operations and a proven track record in successful negotiations.
* Strong presentation skills, captivating senior-level executives with your compelling communication style.
* Experience in developing and implementing dynamic and effective platforms.
* Familiarity with standard demographic research and analytics tools, such as Scarborough, YouGov, MRI-Simmons, etc., with the ability to derive valuable insights from the data.
* Committed to producing high-quality work and adhering to organizational ethics, integrity, and compliance standards.
* An independent and proactive individual with a focus on achieving goals, who can collaborate effectively with colleagues to drive sales for both themselves and the department.
* Possess a high level of energy and self-motivation to drive success.
* Proven experience in managing and motivating a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
* Willingness to travel and work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Desired Skills (but not required)**

* Strong familiarity with sports, especially soccer.
* Bi-lingual (English/Spanish).

**Total Rewards**  

  

Major League Soccer recognizes the importance of attracting and retaining top talent. We offer a highly competitive starting base salary of $115,000 - $150,000, commensurate with individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

Our comprehensive benefits package includes extensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, a $500 wellness reimbursement, generous paid time off, and a hybrid office/remote work schedule to promote a healthy work-life balance. We are committed to supporting your career and professional development through on-the-job training, continuous feedback, and ongoing educational opportunities.
  

  

At Major League Soccer, we take pride in being an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce enhances our ability to compete in the marketplace. As such, we provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

Our commitment is to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities during the job application or interview process, essential job functions, and other employment benefits and privileges. If you need accommodation, please contact us to request it.
  

  

Join our team and become a valued member of the Major League Soccer family, where we continuously elevate the game and inspire greatness!

title: Director, Technical Program Management - Media Ops
description:
**Overview:**  

  

Join Major League Baseball's dynamic Media Operations team as a Director of Technical Program Management. We are searching for individuals passionate about technology and processes that drive our industry. As part of MLB's Media Operations, you will be collaborating with team leads from the Broadcast and Replay Technology teams to spearhead the development of modern, flexible audio and video systems built to deliver content to MLB fans globally and provide the media tools needed to support the game of baseball.
  

  

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Organize team projects and provide strategic and tactical support for projects across the Media Operations team.
* Manage multiple initiatives concurrently, overseeing entire project lifecycles from research to implementation.
* Collaborate with cross functional teams-leads to plan, document, and execute deployment of media technology in support of MLB's streaming and related video initiatives.
* Establish clear communication across multiple verticals to keep teams aligned on expectations as priorities shift and project scopes are adjusted.
* Gather Business requirements for proposed projects to establish scope and schedule, and work with Business Operations on budgeting
* Understand and communicate project status and provide updates to a wide range of stakeholders, including issues and risks across a portfolio of projects.
* Effectively communicate complex concepts or technically challenging project information to both technical and non-technical audiences, including executives.
* Prepare executive weekly status reports using fact-based Key Performance Indicators and issue tracking.
* Work with the Broadcast and Replay Technology team to codify and maintain a five year technology plan, with an eye on emerging technologies and shifting industry standards.

**Qualifications:**

* Strong familiarity with modern broadcast standards and technology, particularly ST 2110, is highly preferred.
* Strong familiarity with modern video IP transport standards and technology, including IP codecs and transport protocols is highly preferred.
* Exceptional organizational skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment handling multiple tasks and priorities.
* Excellent communication skills to effectively engage with agency management stakeholders, cross-team business leads, and vendors, with the ability to tailor communication as needed.
* 5-10 years of experience in media operations, broadcast technology, streaming engineering, or related fields.
* Previous broadcast engineering experience is desirable but not required.
* Experience using and implementing AGILE, SCRUM, Kanban or similar Project Management methodologies.
* Demonstrated ability to set challenging yet realistic goals for self and others.

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
  

  

Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!
  

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $165,000 - $195,000.
  

  

As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision. In addition to your salary, MLB believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package for its employees. MLB offers employees a full range of best in class benefits with no employee contributions towards medical, dental, and vision coverage premiums, as well as incentive and recognition programs, life insurance and automatic employer 401k contributions. All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and the terms of official plan documents which may be modified or amended from time to time.

title: Manager, Partnership Marketing
description:
Overview
  

  

The Manager, Partnership Marketing will manage the day-to-day completion of all activities within assigned Partner Accounts along with other departmental projects as needed. As the key account stakeholder, the manager will be responsible for delivering the highest level of client service while ensuring that effective activation programs are created and implemented. The Manager will have a detailed understanding of their clients' business goals and SUM's larger business strategy and will apply data/insights to grow the business.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Primary day-to-day contact and account management with clients:
	+ Lead weekly calls (includes creating agendas and providing recap notes)
	+ Facilitate workstreams with internal staff
	+ Resolve partner issues
	+ Oversight of asset delivery, tracking, and recapping (i.e. player appearances, tickets, etc.)
	+ Facilitate special requests
* Provide strategic oversight of contractual assets including ticket pools, player appearances, pre-game field experiences, etc.
* Support renewal efforts of current partner contracts by sharing insights based on partner conversations, history and relationships
* Proactively generate ideas for new sponsorship opportunities to grow partner business
* Effectively present information to sponsors and internal stakeholders
* Fiscally responsible for the day-to-day management of partner program budgets
* Lead creative approval process for all partner assets
* Maintain partner information in CRM database, ensuring partner contacts, billing information, and assets are entered correctly and updated as needed
* Support the implementation of partner specific media strategies in collaboration with the media team to deliver against brand objectives and critical metrics
* Champion team development by communicating job expectations with direct reports and managing the Performance Management process:
	+ Plan, monitor, and review performance
	+ Coach and counsel employees
	+ Develop and implement department procedures and productivity standards
	+ Demonstrate/reinforce Company policies and best practices
	+ Develop personal growth opportunities for employees
* Oversee Club relationships for specific partner activation needs (as it applies to partner)
* Lead special projects as requested and serve as PM department stakeholder on cross-departmental projects and initiatives as needed
* Additional responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree
* 5+ years of experience in partnership marketing and sponsorship activation
* Proven experience servicing multimillion dollar partnership

**Required Skills**

* High-level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing
* Demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills
* High attention to detail with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

**Desired Skills**

* Experience managing a direct report preferred
* Knowledge of the sport of soccer
* Ability to travel and to work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary: $75,000 – $85,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game!

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We are committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodations to employees with disabilities. MLS/SUM complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act and all other applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding disability discrimination and accommodation.

title: Media Coordination Scheduler (seasonal)
description:
**2024 MLB Media Coordination Scheduler Job Description**  

  

**Overview**  

  

MLB is currently seeking a part-time seasonal Media Coordination Scheduler to help manage the daily broadcast schedules for the upcoming 2024 Major and Minor League Baseball season. This position will work cross functionally with several internal and external teams to ensure that all games and related events (i.e., press conferences, MLB original content, amateur exhibition games, weekly podcasts, etc.) are streamed live to our viewers correctly and then appropriately archived. The Media Coordination Scheduler will also ensure that any scheduling changes, including last minute gameday disruptions, such as rain delays and cancellations, are rescheduled in a timely and accurate manner.
  

  

An ideal candidate will be available to work a minimum of 30 hours per week and must possess MLB's core competencies in areas such as collaboration, communication, critical thinking, relationship management and the ability to deliver success.
  

  

**Responsibilities**

* Manage the daily MLB and MiLB broadcast schedules and verify that all streaming requirements are met prior to going live on our digital platforms
* Confirm that all non-gameday related events are reflected in the daily schedule and are accurately logged into MLB's internal software programs
* Respond to streaming requests in a timely manner and collaborate with the necessary teams to ensure that the streams go live correctly and without incident
* Communicate gameday related issues to the appropriate teams immediately
* Oversee the MiLB Gameday Monitors and assist them with resolving any game- related issues and emergencies in real time
* Adhere to quality control guidelines and procedures without frequent supervision

**Requirements**

* A flexible schedule tied to the Major and Minor League Baseball season with availability on nights, weekends, and holidays is a must
* A minimum of 30 hours per week is required for this position, no exceptions
* A Bachelor's degree in a related field, with a minimum of 3-5 years in television programming and trafficking is preferred
* Professional experience working with media scheduling software is desired
* Candidates must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills for this position

**Desired**

* Previous work experience in digital media, broadcast trafficking, and/or television programming roles is preferred
* Familiar with MLB.com, MiLB.TV, MLB.TV, MLB At Bat and other streaming services
* Prior sports industry experience is a plus

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is an hourly rate of ($25) to ($25). The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.

title: Analyst, Ticketing Analytics
description:
**Analyst, Ticketing Analytics**  

  

MLB's Strategy & Development (S&D) organization is a centralized resource within Baseball's Office of the Commissioner. The S&D organization works cross-functionally across MLB to support the development and execution of our strategies for growing baseball globally.
  

  

As part of our charter, S&D is a service organization that oversees four key areas:


* *Strategy* : Align Industry strategic direction and provide internal consulting services to League Verticals and Functions, Clubs, Office of the Commissioner
* *Club Biz Ops & Strategy* : Support development of club strategies, best practices, x-functional dialogue
* *Analytics* : Centralized home for data-driven-insights to advise and support Strategy, Clubs, League Verticals and Functions
* *Operations:* Implement and stand-up new initiatives

MLB is hiring an Analyst, Ticket Analytics to be a key contributor in support of some of the top initiatives being undertaken across the industry. This position will report directly to the Director, Ticketing Analytics within the S&D organization and will focus on leveraging data and analytics to help drive business impact with a specific focus on the ticketing vertical.
  

  

The ideal candidate will have an intimate understanding of the complexities of the sports ticketing landscape, and will bring a strong, structured analytical toolkit and experience to a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
  

  

**Main Responsibilities:**

* Own the categorization and mapping of MLB ticketing data
* Work to standardize Club ticketing data in an effort to provide accurate and relevant reporting
* Audit and reconcile ticketing data feeds with financial and Club-submitted reporting
* Build ad-hoc reports and dashboards using primary and secondary ticketing data
* Work as a liaison between Data Engineering and Business teams to help determine structure, ETL processes, and enhancements of the ticketing database
* Assist with day-to-day management and coordination of partner relationships
* Thorough and timely documentation of revenue driving initiatives
* Manage additional projects as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* 1+ years of experience in data strategy and/or analytics roles, ideally within Sports, or Media & entertainment
* College Graduate. B.A./B.S. degree with a relevant academic major (mathematics, statistics, computer science) is strongly preferred, though candidates with non-traditional schooling backgrounds and strong relevant experience will be considered.
* Advanced knowledge of quantitative data collection and data analysis using SQL is required, experience with data science and statistical concepts such as regression modeling in R or Python is preferred
* Ideal candidate will have a low-ego, team-oriented mindset and desire to deliver effective results.
* Desire to implement best practices, processes, and structures to amplify the outputs of the team
* Demonstrated competency in translating data into actionable insights that help define strategic direction
* Desire to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment that regularly integrates with multiple stakeholders including but not limited to strategy teams, BI, and data engineering
* Highly developed communication skills with the ability to story-tell using data and influence executive leadership
* Experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, or other data visualization software is preferred
* Previous experience working within the sports industry is preferred

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
  

  

Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!
  

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $70,000 - $100,000.

title: Director - Financial Reporting
description:
Overview
  

  

The individual is primarily responsible for supporting the League office with management of financial reporting needs.
  

  

The individual will build out financial reporting processes and be a driver of the evolution of the team's role within the business. The Lead will be tasked with driving and coordinating financial information, and process improvements across the organization. The Lead will be responsible for the consolidated financial view for the company, collaborating, and coordinating across Finance and the rest of the organization to provide accurate and timely information.
  

  

The candidate will garner in-depth understanding of key financial and operational practices across a range of finance functions with a focus on building and establishing processes to support the team's day-to-day responsibilities. The candidate will have a strong understanding of Finance procedures and standards, coupled with the ability to build repeatable processes from scratch. The Lead will use systems and technical tools for process improvements, reporting, and other adhoc needs. This role will report into the Vice President of FP&A and with broad exposure to other areas of Finance and the League.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Develop processes to provide consolidated analysis and reporting, working closely with various Finance team members.
* Aid process for management reporting to help synthesize and communicate the financial narrative in concise executive and Board materials.
* Build ad-hoc reports and analysis as needed to evaluate key areas of the business that requires a process change.
* Optimize and automate processes for budget and forecasting with business leads, and monthly close process.
* Assist with evaluation and implementation of new ERP system.
* Drive cross-Finance process improvements and change management, including crafting, sharing, and rolling out standard methodologies in reporting and close processes.
* Maintain systems by adding accounts, adjusting hierarchies, writing reports, clearing errors, and any other need that will arise.
* Consistently ensuring the financial system and data is running efficiently and reliably.
* Implement checks and controls to ensure accuracy of data and reporting.
* Support the overall Finance quarterly forecasting process and calendar, improve the intra-quarter outlook process, and participate in the annual planning/budgeting process.

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Support on projects as needed, including club financial reporting.
* Ad hoc business reporting and analysis as needed.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, business, or related field.
* 8+ years of relevant experience.
* Prior Finance Experience, preferably in a global or large media, tech or entertainment company, with a successful track record of working with teams.
* In-depth understanding of core Finance activities, including reporting, budgeting/forecasting, financial analysis, and modeling.
* Proven track record of advanced analytical skills and ability to work effectively with limited guidance.
* Prior experience with SQL/BigQuery and BI/data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau).
* Advanced Excel skills with a deep understanding of model architecture, formula efficiency, pivot tables, and macros.
* Experience working in a highly collaboratively matrixed environment and leading through influence to achieve goals.
* Analytical and strategic approach with the ability to problem solve through ambiguity.
* Excellent project management skills.

**Desired Skills**

* Financial systems experience such as Hyperion, Adaptive, Anaplan, Oracle, Great Plains,
* Smartsheets, Microsoft BI - experience a plus.
* Python, OpenAI and VBA experience a plus
* Experience working with Finance or Reporting systems and data.

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary $130,000 – 165,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and ongoing educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game! We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: T&e Analyst
description:
The T&E Analyst is responsible for managing review and approval of all travel and expense related activity, ensuring compliance with expense policies, reconciliation of data in the expense reporting system to payments, reconciliation of business related corporate card transactions, and providing exceptional customer service to internal stakeholders. This position requires strong analytical skills, a high degree of accuracy, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
  

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Review and process expense reports daily.
* Audit employee expense reports ensuring adherence to Policy.
* Support Concur Administrator for the expense management application.
* Support Card Administrator for the corporate credit card program.
* Identify, capture, and communicate exceptions to Policy to management.
* Maintain user help desk, respond to inquiries about the expense reporting application, provide support and engage in solutions to user problems to ensure user satisfaction.
* Ensure system audit rules, reminders, and system settings are operating correctly, and employee data is updated accurately and activated.
* Work with the General Accounting team on process improvement and efficiencies where appropriate

**QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS**

* Accounting degree preferred, but not required.
* Minimum of (5) five years' experience processing expense reports.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to multi-task.
* Possess analytical skills.
* Detail oriented.
* Ability to work independently.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Proficient in travel and expense systems.
* Proficient with MS Excel.
* **Location: NYC in-office**

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is **$75,000 - $100,000.** The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.
  

  

As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision. In addition to your salary, MLB believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package for its employees.
  

  

**MLB Perks**  

  

MLB offers employees a full range of best in class benefits with **100% employer no employee contributions towards medical, dental, and vision coverage premiums, automatic employer 401k contributions, generous time off (plus Christmas through New Year's Day),** as well as free tickets to baseball games just to name a few. For more information about our perks and benefits, please check out the *Benefits* section of the MLB Careers Page.
  

  

All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and the terms of official plan documents which may be modified or amended from time to time.
  

  

Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!
  

  

*Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.*

title: Vice President, Consumer Products – Gaming, Collectibles And Emerging Technology
description:
Overview
  

  

The Vice President, Consumer Products – Gaming, Collectibles and Emerging Technology will build a new team to lead the strategic product development, marketing, and community management of MLS Centralized NFT marketplace and manage the existing team responsible for MLS gaming and collectibles partnerships.
  

  

Responsibilities
  

  

**Primary Responsibilities**

* Marketplace Partner Relationship Management
* Product Strategy & Economy Design
* Club Activation and Enablement
* NFT/Partner Community Management

**Product Strategy & Economy Design**

* Lead the product development, business strategy, and community management of MLS gaming, collectibles and other emerging consumer products marketplace serving as a thought leader, coach, mentor, and advocate for a high performing team.
* Partner with Emerging Ventures, Digital Marketing and Technology teams at MLS to integrate consumer product strategy into MLS' broader gaming fan engagement strategy.
* Drive the web 3.0 consumer product roadmap and strategy, work closely with Marketplace partner to bring unique MLS product to market.
* Define and implement ambitious product and marketplace features that maximize key MLS calendar moments positioning MLS as an innovative market leader in the space.
* Inform the marketplace and product category performance scorecard critical metrics, communicate marketplace program progress, escalations, and issue analysis to league stakeholders; collaborate with emerging ventures to recommend and implement changes to processes, products, or business practices.
* Apply strong knowledge of macro and behavioral economics to inform marketplace partners or licensees creation of the product category economy and its monetary lifecycle (production, sinks, inflation).
* Partner with marketplace provider to influence design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other vital documents to communicate design functionality aligned to MLS objectives.
* Relentlessly canvas and study the entirety of the gaming and collectibles entertainment/sports ecosystem/landscape to ensure MLS is continuously diagnosing and learning from industry trends and emerging technologies.

**Commercial Marketing & Community Management**

* Lead internal gaming and collectibles integrated marketing discussions to ensure mutually beneficial value creation for Licensees and MLS
* Drive the launch of NFT collectible, gaming drops with a variety of partners, as well as major product partnerships, especially those projects with more technically complex implementations.
* Define on-platform community strategy, continuous engagement loop to ensure engaged fans continued success as purchasers and traders in the marketplace.
* Lead league and club cross-functional launch and activation efforts partnering internally with Marketing, PM, Technology and Events to balance priorities.
* Grow relationships with new licensees and provide best-in-class support to help them best leverage the MLS marketplace.
* Build and maintain processes to help efficiently manage licensee launches, measure performance, and ensure licensees feel supported.

Qualifications
  

  

**Required Skills**

* Strong knowledge of macro and behavioral economics to inform marketplace partners or licensees creation of the product category economy and its monetary lifecycle (production, sinks, inflation).
* Strategic integrated approach to building business cases, understanding trends and business drivers for taking calculated risks to grow business, applying models relevant to Gaming, Collectible and Web 3.0 ecosystems.
* Strong analytical, research and financial modeling skills to formulate data-driven approach to decision making.
* Demonstrated ability to lead a team, operate and communicate effectively in both large, matrixed organizations, and in lean, “start-up like” environments.
* Proven ability to deliver aggressive critical metrics in defined timeframes.
* Command of contracts and experience working with legal professionals
* Strong communication and presentation skills to interact with both MLS partners and MLS senior leadership.

* Ability to travel 10-20%.
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

**Desired Skills**

* Understanding of sports marketplace dynamics.
* Flexibility to travel and work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary $200,000 - $250,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.

title: Medical Spotter (contract Position-texas)
description:
Overview
  

  

**Contract Length:**

* Seasonal with the eligibility for renewal (7 - 11 months)

**Work Location:**

* Arlington, TX

Responsibilities


* Communication with Venue Medical Director (VMD) regarding potential head injuries.
* Assisting in the concussion protocol process by providing additional information to Club medical staff through written communication and clipped videos.
* Be available for a minimum of 40 matches per season.
* Alert supervisor of any potential injury that requires medical attention.
* Fill out post-match form for each clipped video/incident or match if no clips were needed.
* Recognize visual signs of potential head injuries as outlined by MLS.
* Ability to work nights and weekends based on game day schedules.

Qualifications
  

  

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor's degree or master's degree from an accredited CAATE athletic training education program.
* Minimum 2 years' experience as a certified athletic trainer (ATC) or sports medicine experience with equivalent or higher education.
* Current NATABOC certification.
* Current state licensure in practicing state.

**Required Skills**

* Understanding of head injuries and management.
* Recognition of on-field evaluations.
* Ability to clearly communicate written or verbal as it pertains to the observed visual signs of the MLS Spotter program.
* Ability to multitask.
* Excellent note taking.

**Desired Skills**

* Knowledge of rules regarding medical for the sport of soccer.
* Knowledge of soccer competition rules.
* Previous experience communicating with medical doctors (MD) and doctor of osteopathy (DO).
* Knowledge of 8by8, HeadCheck Health, SmartSheets, Slack Excel, and other software programs.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Information Security Internship
description:
**MAJOR PURPOSE**  

  

Support the MLB Information Security team in the implementation, maintenance, and monitoring of the Major League Baseball Cybersecurity Program.
  

  

**MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Assist the Information Security team with digital investigations, incident response efforts and special projects
* Assist in performing security audits, risk analysis, network forensics and penetration testing
* Develops, creates, maintains, and writes/codes new (or modifies existing) scripts, API integrations, or specialized utility programs
* Support efforts to improve security posture throughout the MLB environment
* Perform administrative duties as needed

**REQUIREMENTS**

* Ability to maintain confidentiality while dealing with sensitive information
* Completed or working towards a Masters or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, Cybersecurity, Criminal Justice, or a related field
* Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or Go, systems engineering using DevOps tooling, or talking to APIs is a plus
* Interest in vulnerability assessment, intrusion/threat detection, digital investigations, mobile device management, log analysis, identity & access management, monitoring, and/or endpoint security
* Relevant certifications such as COMPTIA Security+, Offensive Security OSCP, SANS are a plus
* Strong verbal and written communication skills are a plus
* Self-motivated, strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is an hourly rate of $20.00 to $23.00. The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.
  

  

If you are interested in joining our team and require a reasonable accommodation to assist with any part of the application and/or interview process, please contact us by email at: accommodations@mlb.com

title: Coordinator, Legal & Business Affairs
description:
The Legal & Business Affairs team at Major League Baseball supports the following Legal Department groups: Business & Technology, Global Media, Corporate & Finance, and the General Counsel. The Coordinator will perform the responsibilities set forth below on complex and diverse projects in support of the Legal & Business Affairs team's functions.
  

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Contract Preparation and Administration:
	+ Extensive interaction with the company's (and its affiliates') business units, including licensing, marketing, social media, technology, product, strategy, mobile, ticketing, ballpark experience, enterprise software, information security, human resources and finance, MLB and Minor League Clubs and industry partners;
	+ Management, tracking, preparation and negotiation of company transactional agreements; and
	+ Maintenance of and updates to templates and boilerplate contract clauses
* Compliance Matters: Preliminary review of certain marketing, advertising, promotional, consumer product and other industry assets and assisting with development of applicable terms and conditions
* Research: Legal research needed to support the Legal Department
* Support: Various related tasks and special projects as requested by the Legal Department, including administrative support as necessary

**QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS**

* College graduate and at least two years' experience as a contract administrator / transactional paralegal (or equivalent); experience with software or technology licensing strongly preferred
* Excellent writing, verbal communication and organizational skills
* Top academic credentials and references
* Ability to handle privileged, confidential and sensitive information in an appropriate and professional manner
* Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and simultaneously accomplish multiple quantitatively and qualitatively challenging tasks
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets), Workshare Compare and Internet research

**Why MLB?**  

  

Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of opportunity, collaboration, and professionalism. The professionals who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify and solve problems, put the team first, and work collaboratively. For those who are ready to join the “Major Leagues” of their careers, MLB takes the same approach as they do with their players: striving to empower their own “workforce athletes” to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are ready to step up to the plate and continue transforming America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
  

  

MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment.
  

  

With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
  

  

MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
  

  

Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!
  

  

Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $62,500 - $70,000.
  

  

As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision. In addition to your salary, MLB believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package for its employees. MLB offers employees a full range of best in class benefits with no employee contributions towards medical, dental, and vision coverage premiums, as well as incentive and recognition programs, life insurance and automatic employer 401k contributions. All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and the terms of official plan documents which may be modified or amended from time to time.
  

  

If you are interested in joining our team and require a reasonable accommodation to assist with any part of the application and/or interview process, please contact us by email at: accommodations@mlb.com

title: Director, Financial Planning And Analysis
description:
Overview
  

  

The Director, FPA is a key member of the team managing financial planning and analysis for MLS and SUM. The individual will act as the Finance Business liaison for several departments within MLS/SUM specific to projections, long-range planning, and budgeting. The role should balance being a good business partner for the departments with ensuring sound fiscal process and discipline throughout the organization. This role will lead to comprehensive company-wide analyses, deliver critical financial insights, and support decision-making to propel MLS and SUM towards sustained growth and evolution.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Work continuously as a finance liaison with several departments providing monthly performance/expense management reporting as well as other key actionable metrics.
* Coordinate and manage FP&A's role in the month-end process to analyze actual results of sales and expense details versus the budget/forecast and provide explanations for variances for all team members.
* Provide analytical, accounting and reporting support to the accounting group, including monthly fluctuation explanations of actuals vs. plan/forecast.
* Support the maintenance of company-wide budgets & forecasts in Hyperion, including consolidated and company-by-company views.
* Analyze business opportunities for viability and review contracts to determine financial impact.
* Assist in building management reports for the Board and executive team.
* Develop and coordinate various financial and accounting reports and projects. Gain deep understanding of department roles and responsibilities and ensure responsible fiscal management and effective spending.
* Evaluate the impact of spending on a project basis across departments, ensuring proper fiscal management and effective spending across multiple team members.
* Manage and mentor one FP&A direct report responsible for League Office departments.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree; MBA a plus
* 12+ years of experience in the Accounting or Finance field

**Required Skills**

* Extensive experience in FP&A.
* Superior organization, project management skills and attention to detail.
* Demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills.
* High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance.
* Ability to multi-task effectively in a fast paced, team environment and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally.
* The role will require interaction with all staff levels, including C suite executives. A professional demeanor, the ability to negotiate sensitive matters and the ability to work collaboratively are a must.
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

**Desired Skills**

* High-level excel skills.
* Experience with General Ledger systems such as Great Plains, NetSuite, etc.
* Experience with Hyperion or other Financial Planning tools.
* Experience in the sports industry.

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary: $130,000 – 165,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of our team and inspire you to elevate the Game.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Director, Partner Solutions & Insights
description:
Overview
  

  

The Partner Solutions & Insights department is a centralized, foundational support team dedicated to enabling new business efforts, current partner retention, and identifying/development of property-specific commercial opportunities across Major League Soccer (MLS) and Soccer United Marketing (SUM). The group is seeking a Director who has experience developing integrated marketing platforms and go-to-market narratives dedicated to driving commercial revenue. The Director will play a leading role in platform development and commercial packaging of new and priority sponsor platforms for Major League Soccer (“MLS”) and Soccer United Marketing (“SUM”) properties under the guidance of and collaboration with department leadership. The Director will do this by understanding and applying marketing mix learning, consumer insights, communication strategy and thinking, data-driven analysis, and industry and sponsorship knowledge.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Work closely with business leads to understand sponsorship market trends, enterprise needs and desired deliverables to prioritize development opportunities.
* Liaise with MLS, MLS NEXT Pro, MLS NEXT, MLS GO, Concacaf, FMF, Leagues Cup and Campeones Cup property leads to identity high potential platforms for development.
* Develop sponsorship platforms or assets, coordinating the efforts and contributions of internal and external collaborators, while aligning deliverables to sync effectively into a final work product.
* Champion sponsorship sales and renewal processes through the creation of insights-based proposals demonstrating property performance and unique value proposition
* Support Brand Alliances and Partnership Marketing in delivery and presentation of priority enterprise new business, renewal, and upsell opportunities to clients
* Collaborate with Department Lead to evolve current go-to-market narratives across entire MLS and SUM portfolio
* Keep a pulse on key trends, attitudes, and consumer behaviors across the sports industry and priority/emerging categories – synthesize to advise creative thinking and extract cultural truths to guide strategy
* Analyze work in partnership with Commercial Executive leads to improve partnership structure and valuation methodology, aligning with long term strategy across key properties and categories
* Support the creation of external commercial deliverables inclusive of but not limited to property baseline (GTM narratives), strategic new business proposals, critical partner renewal pitch decks, property sell-sheets, and support in new platform development materials
* Oversee internal platform management documents, including inventory trackers, and sponsor positions/tiering.
* Iterate upon, audit, and evolve centralized point for asset inventory allocation, ensuring commercial revenue is maximized.
* Collaborate with leads across functions (e.g. Media, Content, Properties, Brand)
* Constantly strive for progress, regularly identifying areas of improvement that support the organization achieving its core objectives with a specific focus on metrics, tooling and process
* Support the development of processes and “work shares” to further a culture of learning, integration, and analytical thought
* Contribute to commercial thought leadership efforts that establish MLS and SUM as industry leaders, builds credibility, and incites curiosity
* Assist in any department initiatives or special projects
* Cultivate industry relationships to bring fresh ideas and thinking to development initiatives, and position SUM as a leader with a vision
* Additional responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree, Masters Preferred
* 8+ years of experience
* Extensive experience in sponsorship, media measurement, strategy, and marketing development
* Experience at media/entertainment, Rights Holder, or sports property
* Knowledge of the sport of soccer
* Strong industry relationships with agencies and data and research providers preferred (e.g., Endeavor, Wasserman, Nielsen Sports, Navigate Research, Blinkfire, etc.)

**Required Skills**

* Experience building sports and entertainment properties, platforms and events, including the creation and delivery of new revenue opportunities
* Creative ability to visualize data for Go-To-Market and externally facing sales collateral
* Excellent people skills, with an ability to interact effectively and professionally with internal and external constituents to co-create and achieve organizational goals
* Superior project management skills with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision
* Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to draw conclusions and extract meaningful insights
* High degree of intellectual curiosity and creative insight
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally, with a desire to present to internal and external stakeholders when applicable
* Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment
* Detailed understanding of the sports and entertainment industry
* Strong experience with PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Photoshop and/or Illustrator
* Understanding of the North American sponsorship landscape and how brands use sponsorships to meet business objectives

**Total Rewards**  

  

Starting Base Salary $115,000 - $150,000. MLS/SUM base salaries are contingent upon several factors including individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs.
  

  

We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent through the following:


* Benefits – comprehensive and competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a suite of programs to promote well-being including a $500 Wellness Reimbursement. A generous PTO offering, and hybrid Office/Remote Work Schedule are also offered to promote Work-Life balance.
* Career & Professional Development – on the job training, feedback, and on-going educational opportunities to continue your personal and professional development.
* Employee Engagement – office perks, discounts and employee events that go “beyond the traditional paycheck” to make you feel a part of the team and inspire you to elevate the Game!

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Financial Analyst, Player Finance
description:
Overview
  

  

The Financial Analyst will support management of the MLS player budget and work closely with Player Relations on all financial matters related to player transactions.
  

  

Responsibilities


* Act as a liaison between Finance and Player Relations.
* Support preparation of the player budget.
* Review of all player expenses as it relates to the Club Salary Budgets.
* Review of all player revenues as it relates to outgoing transfers and loans.
* Support Accounting during monthly close and settlement process, including review of player related items.
* Work with Player Relation during year-end review of player compensation, including performance bonuses.
* Support preparation of the player projection for the cash flow statement.
* Support preparation of presentations for internal stakeholders.
* Support Senior Director, Player Finance on projects and ad hoc analysis and reporting.

Qualifications


* Bachelor's Degree, Accounting and/or Finance preferred.
* 2+ years of experience.

**Required Skills**

* Strong financial and accounting skills.
* Superior organization, project management skills and attention to detail with the ability to analyze from a macro level.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally collaboratively across multiple departments.
* Ability to build strong working relationships.
* Adherence to confidentiality.
* High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity, and compliance.
* Ability to work effectively and independently in a fast paced, team environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally.
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
* Demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills.
* Detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines.

**Desired Skills**

* Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP (or similar ERPs).
* Knowledge of the sport of soccer.

**Total Rewards**  

  

Major League Soccer offers a competitive starting base salary of $65,000 – 74,000, based on individual qualifications, market financials, and operational business needs. We are committed to providing a Total Rewards package that attracts, supports, engages, and retains talent. Our benefits package includes comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, a $500 wellness reimbursement, generous PTO, and a hybrid office/remote work schedule to promote work-life balance. We also prioritize career and professional development, offering on-the-job training, feedback, and ongoing educational opportunities.
  

  

At Major League Soccer, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion and believe that a diverse workforce enhances our ability to compete in the marketplace. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  

  

We are dedicated to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation throughout the job application or interview process, essential job functions, and other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please contact us to request it.
  

  

Join our team and be part of the Major League Soccer family, where we elevate the game and inspire greatness!
